explanation:
The report is correct. The condition (ModuleName == NULL || strcmp(StaticSym->Module, ModuleName) == 0) only guards based on ModuleName; if ModuleName != NULL the strcmp is evaluated unconditionally. There is no check or shown invariant ensuring StaticSym->Module is non-NULL for every table entry (the code only uses Name == NULL as the end-of-list sentinel). If StaticSym->Module can be NULL for some entries, calling strcmp with a NULL pointer is undefined behavior and violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 (strcmp is in <string.h> and must not access beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by its pointer parameters).

If, elsewhere in the codebase, there is a documented and enforced invariant that all non-sentinel static symbol records have Module != NULL, then the code would be safe; however no such guarantee is shown here, so the reported violation stands. Recommended fixes include explicitly checking StaticSym->Module for NULL before calling strcmp, e.g.:

if (strcmp(StaticSym->Name, SymbolName) == 0 && (ModuleName == NULL || (StaticSym->Module != NULL && strcmp(StaticSym->Module, ModuleName) == 0)))

or normalizing NULL module names to a sentinel string when building the table.
